***New for 2025:** New entry for 1978, 2010, and 2024*

**1973**: Bruce and the band play their fourth of seven nights at Oliver’s in Boston.

![](https://estreetshuffle.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/1973-0316-1-190x300.jpg)

**1974:** Bruce plays Austin for the first time to a sold-out crowd at Armadillo World Headquarters. He’ll be back in 38 years to the day to keynote at SXSW. (photo credit: Burton Wilson)

![](https://estreetshuffle.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/1974-03-15.jpg)

![](https://estreetshuffle.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/1974-0315-196x300.jpg)

**1975:** Extended studio sessions for *Born to Run* prompt the postponement of a scheduled show in Atlanta.

**1977:** Bruce and the band play their third show in three nights, this time at Broome County Veterans Memorial Arena in Binghamton, New York.

[https://videopress.com/embed/R0xeoh7J](https://videopress.com/embed/R0xeoh7J)

![](https://estreetshuffle.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/1977-03-15-1-300x149.jpg)

![](https://estreetshuffle.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/1977-0315-171x300.jpg)

**1978:** At the Record Plant in New York City, Bruce records “(I Love) Everything About You,” which remains unreleased to this day.

**1988:** In town a day early for his show in Rosemont the next night, Bruce has dinner out at an Italian restaurant.

![](https://estreetshuffle.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/1988-03-15.png)

**1999:** Bono inducts Bruce into the Hall of Fame, and afterward, Bruce and the E Street Band play a mini-set that includes Springsteen classics like “[The Promised Land](http://estreetshuffle.com/index.php/2018/07/04/roll-of-the-dice-the-promised-land/)” and “[Tenth Avenue Freeze-Out](http://estreetshuffle.com/index.php/2018/11/19/roll-of-the-dice-tenth-avenue-freeze-out/),” a duet with Wilson Pickett (and Billy Joel on keyboard) and an all-star jam on “[Let It Be](https://estreetshuffle.com/index.php/2020/11/23/matr-paul-mccartney-billy-joel-bruce-springsteen-and-more-let-it-be/).”

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rnLjmojIp20](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rnLjmojIp20)

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JEiBFELvQm4](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JEiBFELvQm4)

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TZZvd-umMfE](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TZZvd-umMfE)

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J0-aFuZj9qc](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J0-aFuZj9qc)

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K4w0kyYmYVo](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K4w0kyYmYVo)

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NXYNPO3zIj8](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NXYNPO3zIj8)

![](https://estreetshuffle.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/1999-03-15a.png)

![](https://estreetshuffle.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/1999-03-15b.png)

**2004:** Bruce inducts Jackson Browne into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame.

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8YFyC6pnz-k](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8YFyC6pnz-k)

![](https://estreetshuffle.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/The_Ithaca_Journal_Tue__Mar_16__2004_.jpg)

**2010:** Bruce attends the 25th Annual Rock and Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony at the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel in New York City.

**2012:** 38 years to the day after his first concert in Austin, Bruce delivers the keynote address at SXSW.

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VW05XedG4zk](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VW05XedG4zk)

![](https://estreetshuffle.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/The_Toronto_Star_Fri__Mar_16__2012_-scaled.jpg)

After the speech, Bruce plays a warm-up show for the upcoming Wrecking Ball Tour, with guest-stars Jimmy Cliff, Eric Burdon, Joe Ely, Alejandro Escovedo, Tom Morello, Garland Jeffreys, Arcade Fire, and The Low Anthem. Whew!

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OThmS_hMtHk](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OThmS_hMtHk)

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KDqmMmg4F4c](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KDqmMmg4F4c)

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kk7SB6WF2tg](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kk7SB6WF2tg)

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j5go6EKl6Ak](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j5go6EKl6Ak)

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pYdwoJqkMbA](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pYdwoJqkMbA)

**2014:** In today’s episode of Legends of Springsteen, Bruce tours around the Lake Okeechobee area of Florida on his motorcycle, taking selfies and photos, hanging out at a local watering hole, and making a PSA for wearing a bike helmet. Ride along with Bruce via his travelogue [here](https://brucespringsteen.net/news/2014/i-get-around-working-for-the-weekend-2).
> [View this post on Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/p/lsXmw1tu3b/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading)
>

> [A post shared by Bruce Springsteen (@springsteen)](https://www.instagram.com/p/lsXmw1tu3b/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading)



**2016:** Night One of an outstanding three-night stand along the River Tour (2016 Edition), the final stand Bruce will ever play at the Los Angeles Memorial Sports Arena. For more highlights from this show, see my *[Where the Band Was](http://estreetshuffle.com/index.php/2018/03/15/where-the-band-was-los-angeles-march-15-2016/)*report for this show.

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vN0nwWB8sp4](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vN0nwWB8sp4)

![](https://estreetshuffle.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/2016-03-15a-213x300.jpg)

![](https://estreetshuffle.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/2016-03-15b.jpg)

**2018:** *Springsteen on Broadway* continues its theatrical run at the Walter Kerr Theater in New York City.

**2021:** Spotify premieres Episode 5 of *Renegades: Born in the U.S.A.,* the new podcast from Bruce and President Barack Obama. This episode is entitled “Every Man for Himself: Money and the American Dream.” In addition to their conversation, Bruce performs acoustic versions of “[Atlantic City](https://estreetshuffle.com/index.php/2018/06/04/roll-of-the-dice-atlantic-city/)” and “[Used Cars.](https://estreetshuffle.com/index.php/2019/06/13/roll-of-the-dice-used-cars/)”

[https://open.spotify.com/embed/episode/15i7EaLqjjfVeaqMqnj43w?si=4d79a9c9986a40e7&amp;utm_source=oembed](https://open.spotify.com/embed/episode/15i7EaLqjjfVeaqMqnj43w?si=4d79a9c9986a40e7&amp;utm_source=oembed)

**2024:** Bruce and the E Street Band rehearse for the next leg of their world tour, resuming within days in Phoenix.
